result.execSummary:
The defendant Elton M Brackins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, surcharges, assessments and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due on or before 03-22-2016. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept. Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 4 days. TIME SERVED

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elton M Brackins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 4 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days TIME SERVED.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to pay all costs, surcharges, assessments, and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due on or before 03-22-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept. Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

Received and filed with court:
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Elton M Brackins in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled NO CONTEST.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Elton M Brackins in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.   Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Elton M Brackins in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a status conference date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Elton M Brackins in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defendant that he is retaining attorney Dennis Coffey. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM020040  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/15/2015

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Merrill Park.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Elton M Brackins in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  He informed the court that he is hiring private counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-17-2015 at 1:30pm
